name: Stack Panic
description: Catch falling blocks to build wobbly towers while dodging hazards, then watch your tower survive an earthquake to score.
core_loop: Blocks fall from the sky in varied shapes and sizes. Tap/click to lock each block in place as it drops â€” good timing stacks them neatly, bad timing makes the tower lean. Every few seconds a wind gust or tremor tests your tower's stability. Blocks that fall off are lost. Reach height milestones to trigger a full earthquake that violently shakes the screen â€” whatever survives is your score. Then you start the next round with harder block shapes and stronger quakes.
retention_hooks: Earthquake payoff moment â€” watching your tower survive (or hilariously collapse) is inherently shareable and replayable
Height milestones unlock cosmetic block themes (ice, lava, candy) and increasingly dramatic disaster events
Near-miss physics â€” a leaning tower that barely survives feels incredible, creating constant 'one more try' tension
controls: Tap/click anywhere to lock the currently falling block in place. Swipe left/right or arrow keys to nudge it horizontally before locking. That's it â€” two inputs total.
